items.title: Natural Gas Rally Falters Near Key Technical Ceiling; Winter Chill Still Looms
items.summary: a weather-fueled rally in december natural gas futures faded early friday as prices, up more than 12 cents after a small storage build, met stiff resistance.

items.title: Petrobras Readies Next Buzios Platform After Record Output
items.summary: petrobras is closing out 2025 on a high note, preparing to launch yet another floating production unit at the massive búzios oil field after setting multiple output records and raising shareholder payouts. the company has confirmed that the p-78 fpso will begin producing in decem...

items.title: Venture Global boosting Greece’s energy security with long-term LNG supply
items.summary:
venture global, a u.s. producer of liquefied natural gas (lng) sourced from north american basins, has executed a liquefied natural gas (lng) sales and purchase agreement (spa) with atlantic-see lng, a newly formed joint venture between greek companies aktor and depa.
the post ve...

items.title: Oil and Gas Rig Count Ticks Up in the U.S. As Production Hits New High
items.summary: the total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the united states rose this week, according to new data that baker hughes published on friday. the total rig count in the us rose to 548 this week, according to baker hughes, down 37 from this same time last year.  the n...

items.title: AET orders LNG dual-fuel Suezmax duo
items.summary:
aet has awarded shipbuilding contracts to south korea's samsung heavy industries (shi) for two lng dual-fuel suezmax tankers.
the post aet orders lng dual-fuel suezmax duo appeared first on offshore energy.

items.title: Canada’s first large-scale LNG export project firing on all cylinders as it ignites second train
items.summary:
lng canada, a joint venture company encompassing shell, petronas, petrochina, kogas, and mitsubishi, has put into operation mode the second train at its liquefied natural gas (lng) export terminal in kitimat, canada’s british columbia.
the post canada’s first large-scale lng expo...

items.title: No luck for Aker BP in North Sea prospect
items.summary:
norway's aker bp and its partners have drilled a dry well in the north sea.
the post no luck for aker bp in north sea prospect appeared first on offshore energy.

items.title: Wattlab to equip world’s largest battery-powered bulker with solar energy system
items.summary:
dutch maritime solar innovator wattlab has secured a contract with norwegian shipping company berge rederi to install its onboard solar energy system on what is expected to be the world's largest battery-powered bulk carrier.
the post wattlab to equip world’s largest batter...

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Rebound in Choppy Session as Traders Weigh In-line Storage, Mixed Forecasts
items.summary: natural gas futures rebounded thursday after the federal storage report showed a modest build for the traditional end of the injection season, while shifting weather forecasts kept traders on watch for early december cold risks.

items.title: Record LNG Exports, Cold Winter Bets Propel Natural Gas Forwards
items.summary: with the peak heating season approaching and lng exports continuing to break records, natural gas forward prices soared during the oct. 29–nov. 5 trading period.
